definition: to retire/to leave office/to quit a job
to leave/to part from/to be away from/(in giving distances) from/without (sth)/independent of/one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing fire/☲
to abscond/to be absent without leave

sentences.english: Departures from seasonal jobs, such as Census taker, are not counted.
sentences.chinese: 季节性工作人员的离职，如普查人员，没有加入统计。

sentences.english: 'You don't want to quit precipitously since you can traumatize yourself even more by facing extended un employment .
sentences.chinese: 他说，不要仓促离职，因为长期失业会让你更加苦恼。

sentences.english: He had already taken a one-year 1999 sabbatical.
sentences.chinese: 他于是在1999年带薪离职一年。

sentences.english: He stained his military record by going AWOL [a.w.o.l.=absent without official leave].
sentences.chinese: 他因擅离职守而玷污了军绩。

sentences.english: I: Is thatonly reason why you are leaving?
Leave work area without taking safe measure, cause company significant loss.
sentences.chinese: 擅离职守，致公司蒙受重大损失者。

sentences.english: Continue to reduce turnover and improve employee satisfaction.
sentences.chinese: 持续降低离职率和提升员工满意度。

sentences.english: Mr. Katsav denied the allegations and took a leave of absence to fight the charges.
sentences.chinese: 卡察夫否认这些指控，并暂时离职以应付这场官司。

sentences.english: I left my job because my company downsized.
sentences.chinese: 我离职是因为我公司缩小编制。

sentences.english: The previous hangman reportedly quit in 2005.
sentences.chinese: 据报道以前的刽子手已于2005年离职。

sentences.english: However, there are few empirical researches related to middle-level managers' turnover intention.
sentences.chinese: 然而，有关中层管理者离职倾向的实证研究并不多见。

sentences.english: But personage of know the inside story thinks, this coverts namely actually leave one's post.
sentences.chinese: 但有知情人士认为，这实际上就是变相离职。

sentences.english: Role stress is correlated to intention to quit among male nurses.
sentences.chinese: 男护士角色压力与离职倾向呈显著相关。

sentences.english: Is it necessary to sign the confidential agreement provided that a non-competition agreement has been signed?
sentences.chinese: 签订了保密协议还有必要签订离职竞业禁止协议吗？

definition: executive/senior management/(contraction of 高級管理|高级管理)
to cut staff/to lay off employees
to get a better job somewhere else (idiom)/to seek alternative employment
to quit one's job (without having another one)
to be transferred to another post/to post away
